## Validators.recordOf() function

A helper function to create a [Validator](./ts-utils.validation.validator.md) which validates the `string`<!-- -->-keyed properties using a supplied [Validator&lt;T, TC&gt;](./ts-utils.validation.validator.md) to produce a `Record<TK, T>`<!-- -->.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function recordOf<T, TC = unknown, TK extends string = string>(validator: Validator<T, TC>, options?: IRecordOfValidatorOptions<TK, TC>): Validator<Record<TK, T>, TC>;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description

validator


</td><td>

[Validator](./ts-utils.validator.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, TC&gt;


</td><td>

[Validator](./ts-utils.validation.validator.md) used for each item in the source object.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[IRecordOfValidatorOptions](./ts-utils.validators.irecordofvalidatoroptions.md)<!-- -->&lt;TK, TC&gt;


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional [IRecordOfValidatorOptions&lt;TK, TC&gt;](./ts-utils.validators.irecordofvalidatoroptions.md) which supplies a key validator and/or error-handling options.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[Validator](./ts-utils.validator.md)<!-- -->&lt;Record&lt;TK, T&gt;, TC&gt;

A [Validator](./ts-utils.validation.validator.md) which validates `Record<TK, T>`<!-- -->.

## Remarks

If present, the supplied [options](./ts-utils.validators.irecordofvalidatoroptions.md) can provide a strongly-typed validator for keys and/or control the handling of elements that fail validation.
